summary: Newly arrived at her family's lake-island cabin, college student Sara (Sara Paxton) and her friends prepare for a weekend of fun in the sun. But soon after they dive into the lake, football player Malik (Sinqua Walls) stumbles out of the water with a grievous wound. Thinking Malik is the victim of a freak accident, the friends pile into a tiny speedboat and head for the hospital. To their horror, they discover that they are surrounded by hundreds of massive, hungry sharks.

reviews.content:
Like most shark movies a group of beautiful friends heads to a lake house for a fun water sports filled weekend not suspecting that a man eating shark is looking to take a bite out of their fun. 
Typical shark flick although they added in some human predators in a secondary storyline.  The cast makes this better than it should be.  The CGI shark isn't very convincing. Sara Paxton and Katherine McPhee make this an enjoyable viewing.

If you're a fan of shark horror, this is worth watching at least once because of all the detail put into the sharks to make them appear realistic. Their unlikely eagerness to attack hapless college students is never explained (were the sharks drugged with something?)  but they used a mix of CGI and practical effects to create beautiful replicas of various species which is what makes this worth viewing. On contrast, I found most of the acting  sy- Fi b movie sharknado quality at best which may be  the fault of the writer as the characters are unsympathetic and not really likable, nor really  annoying enough to be dis likable so you can really enjoy or mourn them getting eaten. You're literally just watching to see how creative the sharks can be with when and how they strike.  Also, I have never figured out the back story with Sara and her ex boyfriend, whether he actually attempted to drown her or whether she was a hysterical teenager that flipped out, jumped to conclusions, ran over and nearly killed her lover with a boat and then dumped him at a hospital without so much as a goodbye. Shouldn't there have been a police investigation into all this? And also, she wears a bikini through the entire film despite it being here house and having access to her own clothing. I mean, after my first friend got  his arm bitten off, I'd sort of feel inappropriate running around in a two piece and a thin robe. If you're going to take someone to a hospital, you usually want to be wearing some pants and sweater because you're gonna be sitting in a waiting room for a few hours at least and you don't want a bunch of people staring at you while you wait for hours to find out if someone will live or not I'd imagine.

Wow... what a piece of dung. There's very little too redeem this. It's got a decent cast, I guess, but it doesn't help that they're a bunch of cartoon characters. We don't even get some nice, bloody shark kills, thanks to the pg rating. Just a bunch of cheesy ludicrous moments.
It's super fun, simple solid plot, good effects, fine tension for a movie of this sort and a totally enjoyable watch.

"Shark Night" plays like a cross between "Sharknado" and "Deliverance", but it somehow isn't much fun to watch. There's too little exciting action, even of the goofy overblown-CGI kind, which is the least that may be expected from this movie. The actual shark scenes are almost always one-sided and dependent on banal contrivances so that people are eaten but there is neither suspense nor actual palpable conflict between man and man-eating fish. 
Much of the movie centers way too much four rednecks who capture the protagonists, then torment and feed them to the sharks. It's not fun to watch the characters being terrorized. It's not fun watching them being helplessly dropped into the water as shark bait. It isn't fun when one of the rednecks makes a female protagonist strip then drop herself into the water as bait. 
And it is not fun in the meantime to watch the romantic dilemma between Sara and Nick, who are obligatory, standard, and do nothing out of the ordinary.
This movie sucked lol. 0 stars if I could

Good watch, might watch again, and can recommend if you like horror / sharks.

I imagine for someone who doesn't care about sharks, this might actually be a little boring.  They're used really well for a horror mechanic, there is almost a Rob Zombie vibe to this one.

The weirdest part of "sharks in a lake" is how the sharks are surviving, or if we believe the movie discussion that it's a "salt water lake".  There are lakes of weirder stuff, so a lake of salt water is reasonable, but it is very clear when you are in salt water versus fresh water.

It is honestly the biggest problem with the movie: the rest makes a lot of sense so it doesn't play with your suspension of disbelief.  The story is well structured, and the actors mostly do a good job.

Overall, it's just not the best movie though.  I personally don't mind forces of nature as adversity / antagonists, I liked "Crawl", but it has to done with a good delivery.

I don't feel like I care about the characters or the sharks all that much.

It feels like there should be options to just stay out of the water, which is what makes "sharks in the ocean" scary, its harder to get away.

In the end its a good watch that feels like it should be a great watch, but that could just be critical thinking defeating my movie experience.
honestly one of the worst movies i've ever seen. it  made absolutely no sense, but i did have a good time making fun of it lol.

I don't know what you guys went in expecting after seeing the trailer and walking into a movie called Shark Night that is rated PG13, but it is at least entertaining.  Don't get me wrong...it's a bad movie, but a whole lot more entertaining than most bad movies.  
Watch it expecting PG13 violence and a whole lot of camp and you won't be too disappointed.
We rated this one second on best shark films. Less generic than  all other shark films but could the first half definitely could leave you thinking your watching American pie

I'm always amazed when a shark movie can be so dull. There are a few okay action sequences, but shark movies are about suspense. It's supposed to be fun scenes involving people yelling "Get out of the water!" or "Hurry up! Get back in the boat!" And things like that. This one seemed more like a PG-13 slasher film with a bunch of teens partying on the bayou and running afoul locals in shark infested waters. I suppose the action wasn't terrible, but it also wasn't all that interesting. Meh.

Shark night is underrated. It's a pretty good movie. I would like it better if it was a little more gory though. They don't show the sharks eating the people. They kind of move the camera away just as the person is being eaten to maintain a pg-13 rating.
Nothing new in terms of shark movies, but it's not that bad.
Alive dog tossed into water to be eaten. Female are sexually humiliated and harrasment. Bad taste. Nothing art of filming about it. Satisfied with director's sexist and animal abuse fantasy.
cliche' after cliche' of bad movies. Predictable from the get go, except for the unbelievable plot twists, which were just stupid.
How do they even make a movie this bad I dont get it. Its like they are told, hey make a shark movie but make it so that is sucks.
I thought it was good the effects are amazing and the acting is so kickass

I don't understand how people are so extremely critical of this film lol... this isn't the worst shark film I've ever seen and I've practically seen them all by this point in my life. The performances aren't wooden they're pretty good and decent for a B-movie like Shark Night. People complaining that there's not enough shark action in the film... if you want shark action that takes up the entirety of the film then just watch blue planet!. You can't always please everyone but the reviews of this film are just being nit picky and people just trying to downsize a decently made film with some good humour and good panic scenes. People need to stop expecting so much from B-Movies and just enjoy the fact that they are B-MOVIES!!!! I really enjoyed this film and found the characters and actors very enjoyable to watch. If this was a slasher movie people would love it but because it has to do with sharks most critics and viewers expect Jaws-Esque movie quality. Whereas us B-Movie lovers just enjoy these types of films for what they really are.

Absolutely brilliant film. Amazing animatronics, so real. Supreme attention to detail. Awe inspiring and frightening all at the same time. This director knows what he is doing and the actors aren't as vacuous as usual. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and hope to see more from this director. Excellent Saturday night fare for anyone over 12.
worst film ever made!

Spoiler alert. I'm going to ignore the fact that sharks don't actively seek out and eat people because all shark movies do this. I'm also ignoring the fact that people can't see clearly underwater without goggles because every movies with water does this. Shark Night had me constantly rolling my eyes aside from these things. 
First of all the opening of this movie wants to be Jaws so bad I got whiplash. A group of "end of high school kids", who look like they're in their mid-20s, head off on a vacation to a lake house. On the way they meet a childhood friend/sheriff, an ex-boyfriend, and a couple completely psychotic stereotypical rednecks.  In fact as the movie progresses there end up being more psychopaths, all of varying degree of insane for reasons that also vary in explanation. 
Once they arrive they have some typical horror movie college bound "kids" fun till Uh OH! A shark plucks one out of the water and rips his arm off.... Not eats... just takes it off. Despite this the gentleman makes it to shore and proceeds to bog the rest of the group down as they try to get him help. One would think just stay out of the water... but no. They go back into the water several times (once on a damn skidoo) and loose members of their party one by one to the various lake sharks. Why are sharks in a lake? Because the various psychopaths put them there... somehow.
The main villain of this movie I believe was written to be a grotesque man with a disfigured face. They tell this story of how the ex-girlfriend/party member tore his face up with a boat propeller on accident, and now he's doomed to a life of horror!... except he's like a GQ model with a small hardly noticeable scar on his cheek.
The whole movie is full of CGI sharks launching themselves out of the water at people in a totally overdone way, stupid people going out into the water despite knowing the sharks are there, psychopaths who are inhumanely crazy to the point where they have no problem murdering people in cold blood for no reason, and a terrible ending of a typical shark jumping at the camera. It has been done and over done better before.

Es una pena que la poca destreza del director haya hecho que la primera parte de la película sea tan poco constructiva, o más bien destructiva, para la cinta. Una idea decente correctamente ejecutada en su fase media y final pero muy mala de inicio. El resultado es una película que podía haber sido mucho más fácilmente. Mi nota es un 4.

Versión completa en: Vaderexpress.blogspot.com
Shark Night is not good or terrible, but falls in the "So bad it's good vibe" making it acceptable.
Sad Jaws ripoff.  With serial killers controlling the sharks.  Really bad.
Sara Paxton still manages to give a surprisingly competent performance in this somewhat enjoyable, deeply deeply stupid, PG-13 exploitation movie.
The movie as a whole is "ok", the animatronic sharks look great but it's a shame they had to put in some crappy cgi ones as well.

I work at a library (yes, it's awesome), and am in the cataloging department. This little gem may have slipped by getting added to our library's DVD section if I hadn't pulled it off the donation cart. How someone could give up this gem, I'm not sure, but I'm glad they did because I, and numerous library patrons, will now be able to enjoy it.

Nerds, Jocks and Hot Girls all get along together, which is nice to see. Then you have the typical redneck, which of course you will find on the way to your giant lake house that has no neighbors close by. Once we get to the house, that's when the mangling and dismembering begins. What they think of as a freak thing, (the shark must have came through the levy after hurricane season), quickly turns into sharks everywhere. 

The sheriff (who plays Harvey on Gotham... love that crazy show), adds some comic relief as the bumbling country bumpkin. Very little nudity, and no sex, just lots and lots of blood. The final reason as to why this is happening makes sense in a twisted way. And honestly I'm surprised something like this hasn't happened in real life... or maybe it has. So next time you're near a saltwater lake, you might want to let your friends go for a swim while you stay on the beach.

Wow that was terrible. Terrible acting, stupid story and not barely watchable. I also love how they throw out shark facts that we have all known for years. Best part was the sharks. Don't waste your time.

Obviously it is shit but it's so fun. 
You know this. You wouldn't even consider watching a movie called "Shark Night 3D" if you weren't a part of the shameful shark horror circle. Just embrace it - there are many species of sharks to be seen here.

Not much to this film.  College kids near a lake unsuspectedly become terrorized by sharks.  The "twist" that turns up halfway through is ridiculous and lame.  The 3D isn't very good, and most of the time the practical-created sharks look worse than the CGI ones in other films.  The most bizarre distraction is the shark-like teeth one of the actors wear.

The premise offers B movie thrills, But Shark night is painfully neutered by it's unnecessary PG-13 rating, which means no gratuitous gore or nudity, but that's what makes a B movie. It's why we watch those goofy Syfy original movies! In short, this is no spiritual successor to Jaws not is it a good rip off.
A woeful script with null gore, sex or excitement. What was the point?
It was better than Zombeavers, so that earns it a 1/5.

Shark Night is hated by many because of how poorly structured the plot is and the movie pretty much all over the place, half of the movie not even focused on sharks. That is true, which is why I love it. The flick pushed the limits way too far with the PG-13 rating, if you ask me. The violence is over the top, and is pretty disturbing too. I though, loved this movie and thought it was highly entertaining.

An immensely boring vichyssoise of Lake Placid and Cabin Fever, Shark Night is an exploitation film to an extent as it exploits its audience and buys into the 3D gimmick that seemed so popular around the 2010-2011 mark. The producers of Shark Night don't care about sharks, they don't care about horror and they don't care about films...they care about money. David R. Ellis also directed Snakes on a Plane which was better as it was more self-aware, acknowledging and directly referencing its own outlandishness, however Shark Night 3D believes its scary and that's disappointing.
It gets points for trying to do something different but just because it is different doesn't make it good.

The only legacy this movie had was that it without question claimed the crown of "Anti-Jaws" from a quality perspective, but then Sharknado came along and literally blew it out of the water. Now it doesn't even merit one viewing.
There have been far worse water creature movies, but Shark Night is far too tame to provide any real entertainment.

En någorlunda underhållande hajrulle, som tyvärr inte innehåller särskilt fantasieggande attacksekvenser. Man skulle kunna beskriva det hela som en mix av The Texas Chain Saw Massacre, Jaws och Piranha 3D, men med betydligt mindre glimt i ögat och finess än den sistnämnda. Men hajarna är åtminstone härligt bindgalna och blodtörstiga, och det är ju alltid något att hänga i granen, så här i juletid!
Verges on being self-aware and creative enough to be entertaining, but not quite.
Why do horror movies always have to be so cheesy?
Movie really suck I wish u can it negative stars

Simply dreadful. Not to say I was expecting anything even close to respectable, but I was still hugely disappointed. Imagine 'Piranha 3D' with somehow even worse acting, dialogue and effects with sharks substituted for piranhas and you get the idea. I know that's hard to imagine, but it is somehow acomplished. 

As I said, the acting is just TERRIBLE. The writing and character interaction is worse. The direction is seizure inducing and impossible to follow. The story is ludicrous. The sharks are rendered using Playstation 2 graphics. Just an unbelievable piece of garbage to put it bluntly. 

Full of insanely stupid plot devices and blatant disinformation about sharks, it succeeds in being horrible both as a legitimate film and as an exploitation piece. So many head-scratching moments that I really can't even begin to scratch the surface. 

Really, there is nothing whatsoever to like about the movie. I'd have to say that this is a solid step behind even the horrible 'Shark Attack' series and pretty much every SyFy Original shark movie ever made. I'm having a hard time remembering why I'm giving it 1.5 stars, because its probably at least a half a star too high.

I don't know who goes into this movie expecting anything in the realm of 'good film'. I'd love to know what you're taking to make you think so optimistically and do you need a prescription? Now, clearly a heaping pile of b-grade low-budg chum - I have to say I went in with dirt low expectations and I laughed. I thought it was entertaining for what it was and made me giggle.

A bit terrifying the idea of some sharks in a calm lake in a small town, but just because sharks are terrifying by themselves. For the rest, the hot girl chosen by the director is hot but not that hot.

Powered by an atrocious plot and awful acting, 'Shark Night 3D' still manages to offer a tiny bit of entertainment, if you're looking for comedy where it shouldn't be found. One of this film's biggest drawbacks lies in its PG-13 rating; whereas a film like 'Piranha 3D' manages to put forth an incredibly enjoyable effort by going all out, this film almost feels stunted and unfulfilled. 

Without giving too much away, I do have to say that this movie has one of the most ridiculous twists I've ever seen, but it's so far out there that it's almost bitingly perfect. This is one of my favorite unintentional comedies, and for that reason, I cannot completely dismiss it.

***

certainlycinema.com
facebook.com/certainlycinema
Instagram: @certainlycinema
One fateful day at the movie theatre I was sitting outside, debating what movie should I watch. I chose this one. I regret life.

Hilarious. You've got to love horror movies. I've enjoyed much worse. Something about healthy, happy, and shallow teens getting picked off when they expected a party vay-cay just never gets old for me.
At least it's not the worst shark movie ever.
Just the last few movies we've seen for almost a decade on SyFy. Everything is just plain stupid, even the deaths I found quite amusing.
this "Night" is one you'll quickly forget.
A bunch of sharks eating a bunch of people. What more could you ask for? Maybe a good story perhaps?

For six college bound teens a getaway is exactly what they need. So when Sara invites her mates to her island beach-house for a sun soaked weekend they go without question, but once they arrive they find out that the lake surrounding Sara's idyllic beach-house is infested with sharks, huge sharks, but who put them there? The story is your typical teen schlock-fest slasher with no suspense, tacky gore and basic run of the mill characterse: A sexy slutty type, cocky arrogant guy, cool black dude, his hot girlfriend and a nerdy guy, but two of the characters aren't bland and they are played by Sara Paxton and Dustin Milligan as Sara and Nick, the former being a young girl with a past she'd like to forget and the latter a devoted college student desperate to pass his course, and these two alone drive the movie away from most of the generic parts and are actually enjoyable to watch. Paxton is severely underrated, she was incredible in The Innkeepers and Last House On The Left and she is the saviour of Shark Night. The direction is lousy, David R. Ellis throws in fast forward montages accompanied by cheap guitar riffs and the result cheapens the film giving it a TV movie feel, the movie lacks tension, even considering that this is one of the gore-fests there should at least be palpable air of suspense, like Final Destination but instead we get sharks that fly out the water which in turn delivers unintentional laughs, I enjoyed myself at parts but never thrilled.
So a shark can catch up to a man waterskiing but can cant catch up to another man right in front of the shark , swimming with one hand? Lame

A lake full of the fastest swimming supersharks on the planet feasting on a bunch of half naked college kids. Sign me up! If this had been low budget like most of the horror films I watch, I'd say it was pretty good, considering, but this had a 25 million dollar budget. For this type of film, with that kind of budget, ya, not that great. It was fun enough though, and two people even lived! A couple bouncing boobies sometimes make all the difference in such a film. Fuck the PG-13 crap. I love it though, that in our ridiculous society, being eaten by a shark, severed body parts, blood, kidnapping, sadism and torture are all PG-13 as long as you keep your clothes on, but show a couple in bed and the morality pigs go MAD! MAD! Aww, fuck it, who cares, watch Jaws instead.
Awesome movie!!  It was fun and entertaining!!  The sharks were pretty vicious!!  It also had cool action scenes!!  If you are looking for an intense Shark movie, than I don't recommend this to you!!

I didn't hope so much for this movie and of course it turns out bad,really really bad. It just another rip-off of a thrilling shark movie,but this one is not thrilling or even scary not even a bit. The acting was awful and the CGI of the shark was so bad that it makes a horror movie (?) laughable. I like plot twist, especially the gripping ones but this movie plot twist was horrible, the shark was released by the humans because they are inspired by the DC's Shark Week. Eh,really?Boring.... Too bad zero stars is not an option.

The premise is really moronic: since Shark week draws big ratings, people will pay to see sharks kill real people on the Internet. 7 friends take a weekend trip to the salt-water lake housing the killer sharks and the fun begins. Fairly acted, nicely paced, a couple of good-looking ladies in bikinis, but the story and script are too awful to make it more than a curiosity for shark fans. Good effort, but fail.

Horribly written, woodenly acted and a lack of suspense or violence. Shark Night ranks as one of the worse Shark monster movies of all time. Plus it doesn't help when the director can't decide weather he wants to make a horror film or a teen comedy.
This is an awfully predictable, and downright lazily constructed sharks gone amok flick that's completely depleted of even the simplest of campy thrills.
Terrible movie. Wow. the shark was the best actor in this movie. Would have rated it lower but a shark attack is a shark attack no matter how bad the in between scenes are.
Shark Night 3D is unoriginal, campy, and poorly acted. watching this movie is a holy miserable experience.
Everything about it is predictable......except that song that plays after the credits.
"Not that great, but if you're looking for a hot, summer monster B-movie, you might as well try watching it."

At one point I thought Shark Night sounded cool. Then I thought it sounded like the stupidest thing in the world. But to be sure I had to see it for myself.

The thing that made it the stupidest thing in the world was the fact that it was dumbed down to an American PG-13 rating and Australian M15 Rating to ensure that wide audiences could see it without it being too excessive or crude. Unfortunately, I cannot think of any audiences that would be flocking to see this dribble and come out entertained.
For one thing, its editing style is seriously retarded. It cuts back and fourth between fast forwarding its shots and leaving them at a regular pace during various scenes.
And frankly, it's not worth writing a review over but I guess I'm going to have to. It's because Shark Night matches its unintelligent script and poor visual effects with one of, if not the single stupidest plot to have ever been featured in a shark movie.
Even the idea that there may be some form of cheap fun is too much to ask for from Shark Night, and instead its just a film that must really hate the viewer to be this terrible.
Although Sara Paxton's sex appeal and performance, as well as the performance of Sinqua Walls are generally appealing, Shark Night is a ticking time bomb set to self destruct once it completely disintegrates.
Pretty much no one had a chance to survive. No surprise throughout. Cookie cutter death didn't look deadly. Sharks swam too fast. Could've been a better story or at least better death scenes.

Not much on shark stories but it could have been alot worse. From the director of The Final Destination. I didn't watch it in 3D. A woman playing in the water and her boyfriend taking her binkini top off and making her go and get it. Then LPP something grabs her from below leaving only blood behind. A group of friends go out to a lake to have fun. They go to Sara's nice cabin/house. blood from malik arrm drips down the drain of the boat attracking the shark. The shark bumps the boat. The boat blows up. They go back to the house. Crazy with grief for his girl my a he goes after a shark in the water. The "locales" put the sharks in the water. Shark attacks for entertainment. Sarah caused an accident that caused face damage on one of the "locales"
Noting unexpected here.
It's terrible obviously and completely ridiculous. At least it's not misogynist trash like 'Piranha' I guess and they're not really taking it all seriously, are they? Right? Right??
They tried to make the first scene similar to what was done in Jaws but it was not believable.  The sharks are totally unrealistic on how they moved and behaved.  This is a pathetic shark movie.

This film was surprisingly decent. I was not expecting that at all. It had some good suspense, good enough acting, and one pretty flippin awesome scene involving a guy on a jet-ski. While it succeeds in those areas, it still comes across as overly cheesy, sometimes stupid, and the effects aren't that great either.
I'm curious though; How did this movie get away with a pg-13 rating?

I watched this with a friend who is Italian to have some racial diversity, and we pretty much summed up that the problem with Shark Night is that it's characters are a pack of phenomenal idiots: you are in a house on an island surrounded by shark infested waters, what do you do: "Stay away from the f**king water!" Even if this was a typical B-movie piece of junk with gore and boobs, it would still fall flat on it's ass, never mind the plot which has two guys feeding people to sharks so they can film it and put it on television. No, f**king really. Even the sharks are boring. How can you make a sharks, boobs and gore movie and not include any of that. That's like making Jaws without a f**king shark.

I'll often times give movies this low of a score just to make a point about how much worse  it was than what the general consensus is, but in this case, Shark Night (3D) deserved every bit of it. Why this script was green-lit is unexplainable until you realize that the same mind behind Snakes On A Plane, David R. Ellis, was most likely the driving force behind this film being made. The two films have the same feel to them, except that Snakes On A Plane had a MUCH better script. Even the most talented director (which I'm most certainly not claiming David R. Ellis is) couldn't make this work. The driving force behind this movie was the CGI, and even that was horrific. Worse yet, this was the movie that sparked like-minded films to be made which culminated in Piranha 3DD being birthed into this world. Bottom line, if you liked this movie or even though it was an acceptable piece of cinema in any way, we really can't be friends anymore.
Because of the PG-13 rating, Shark Night suffers from a lack of gore and potential nudity along with a idiotic plot and poor visual effects.
i dont like the title name given to the Movie it should be SHARK LAKE
Corniest, funniest C grade movie eva.
one of my least favourite films of all time
One of my top worst films of all time

Meh its ok for 85 mins I guess. When you have alot of crappy shark films released on the sy fy channel you cant expect too much. Tries to be as fun as Piranha but ultimately fails. 2/5 is the best I can give it, afterall the characters are totally unlikeable and the shark looks as fake as ever
One of my least favourite movies of all time. It's not director David Ellis's fault I blame the script because David Ellis films usually are pretty good
i enjoyed this movie! it was scary, and entertaining. the only flaw is its bad special effects and animation. the sharks were corny but other than that it is a good movie

Holy fucking shit this was bad, no wait fuck that, this film was an abortion of epic proportions.  Shark Night 3D is as bad as the title says for so many reasons.  For starters, it's a PG-13, so if you were at least looking for gore and naked starving actresses, you're very out of luck.  The story is horrid and gives you easily no reason to give a shit throughout the runtime.  There's zero character development, though that's not much of a problem on account that the acting is literally non-existent.  The biggest problem though is the lack of direction or script; in all honesty I don't think the film had either, seriously this felt like really bad improve with cheap effects.  Oh, did I say cheap effects, yup; somehow with a $25 million budget, the film looks like it cost less than a Sci-Fi channel film.  The only reason I gave it a .5/5 instead of a zero was simply because at times, especially towards the end, I laughed uncontrollably just seeing how horrendous it was.  Don't get the impression that you should watch it, because in no way shape or form should you; the moments of laughing was rare for me and didn't make up for the fact I lost 90 minutes of my life to this crap.

Did you ever want to know what a PG-13 generic horror film would look like, well if you did just know it's shit.
Pretty good shark movie
Stupid characters stupid story, stupid looking digital sharks (although they looked better then Jaws ever did). Terrible film.
A good time... If you're drunk.
If you were expecting a liquefied brain by the end, you are only half right. Expect the obvious  filled with clichés with the exception of almost no nudity.

When a group of school friends visit the Louisiana bayous for a weekend party, they discover that the water is the most dangerous place to be. 

The killer shark genre are a weird breed of movies that, apart from Jaws, invariably end up being very, very bad, but they never seem to go away. Shark Night is an odd entry as (to it's credit) it tries to do something different from the usual story lines that you have seen it the past. The plot moves along at a healthy rate and even though the beginning is a pretty standard affair, things take a bit of a twist about three quarters of the way in, and though it is all becomes quite unbelievable, and not very well explained, it is still quite a fun story. The cast of unknowns all play their roles very well, and you actually kind of care for the generic characters as they are not as distasteful as a lot of other movies out there. The CGI is plentiful and range from the very good Cookie Cutter Sharks to some pretty abysmal blue screen sequences, but the mechanical shark effects are very well handled. All in all, this is still quite a flawed movie, but it is a lot better than a majority of entries in the killer shark genre, and with it's above average production values, it ends up quite a fun way to spend 85 minutes.

Good film but still they have yet to make something remotely comparable to Jaws. Love shark films and this is one of the better ones, good kills, some a tad unrealistic and some obviously cgi but very good none the less. Could have had a bit more gory scenes for the rating of 15. Good film liked it a lot :-)

It was better than the typical shark movie, u know where all the characters are dumb, this one is a little like that only the people aren't as dumb. The storyline was pretty basic, no jump scenes or none that even try to scare u, basically u see the deaths coming throughout the movie. The best part about it is the dog in it, that dog was (how my girlfriend put it) was very devoted to the owner of him. I would watch it again. Would I recommend it? If u like a simple shark movie with an alright cast then yes you'll like this one
Today I saw this movie with my friend after it was finished I was very disappointed, and my friend agreed also. Thank goodness that I didn't waste my money at the theater when it was out.

Shark Night has moments of entertainment (which is not a lot), but it's also hampered by unrealistic CGI sharks, a flimsy script, wooden acting and a mediocre story.

I saw this movie this afternoon.  It was not what I expected, but it was alright.  It could have been better.  

For starters, this horror movie should have been rated R and add lot more gory 3D scenes of the sharks killing the humans.  Second, I could have done without the fast forward editing of some irrelevant scenes, but I understand that the movie needed to get going.  Overall, it had a decent story that's reminiscent of Deliverance, but with sharks.

A weekend escape turns deadly for a group of college students when they encounter a group of man-eating sharks in the waters surrounding their remote island getaway! Make no mistake about it, the PG-13 rating for SHARK NIGHT clearly designates both the intended audience and the level of intelligence behind the script. Every attempt to make this movie "hip" for the younger generations instead comes off as being trite and cliche, and every move the characters make is utterly predictable... That is, up until the ridiculous final act. Technology has apparently devolved once again, considering that the computerized sharks in SHARK NIGHT look worse than those created 13 years ago in DEEP BLUE SEA. It is also sad to think that a film like this could ever have made it in to theaters, when the quality of the overall production falls behind many of the awful made-for-TV movies that drown the SyFy channel yearly. At least with the 2010 PIRANHA remake, Alexandre Aja knew enough to play up the high camp in the picture, and delivered an abusive amount of gore. There is no fun to be had anywhere in SHARK NIGHT, and it is nearly bloodless. Do not waste your time on this pathetic film. 

-Carl Manes

List of pluses and minuses for a shark "horror" film:
+ The sharks are well done,
- but so far out with the jumping and leaping that they lose credibility and believability
+ the idea is interesting
- but the plot is very simple, over-simplified even
+ There's quite a lot of action 
- but not enough for such a short movie with such a flimsy storyline
- The dialogue is just bland and pointless
- and the characters are cardboard thin and one dimensional.
Even so this is in my opinion a better film than Piranha for instance. Sharks give this movie potential, but its not used. The situations are not believable (such as a person losing an arm all the way to the shoulder and walking around afte a little recuperating and no doctors, medicines etc). So this is not quite on par with Deep Blue Sea, but its stil relatively watchable, even though its silly and not really fun at all.
i guess it was an okay movie not that fun but it is a pretty good shark movie  explaining that it had a pretty good plot

Its an okay movie but nothing can beat JAWS.

Ok I went to see this movie to have a bit of a laugh as I knew it wouldn't really be a good movie but Lord Have Mercy nothing could have prepared me for the total, utter, nasty piece of crap movie that was Shark Night 3D. It has to be one of the worse movies I've seen in ages. Ok the premise, which you can see from the trailer was that some college kids go out to an island surrounded by a salt water lake that happens to have tons of Sharks living in it. Now the question in the movie is 'how did the sharks get in this lake?'. Now when it came to the reveal of this question, it had to be one of the worse reasons ever to why the sharks were there. I mean it was seriously something you would come up with if you were totally drunk!!! So basically the story was crap. Ok lets get onto the death scenes! Now I know a bit about sharks and I can tell you that the sharks in this movie were like......Super or something. We all know that sharks are fast swimmers but these sharks were swimming at Warp Speed!!! (Spoiler alert) I mean there was one scene where a shark jumped out of the water at some speed and bit a guys head off when he was on a Jet Ski!! I was like "WHAT!!" Also and I hate saying this but there was a token black guy in the film. Now I'm not going to go into what they did to this guy throughout the film as it just makes me angry!! Let's just say he got it worse than anyone!! By the end of the film I guarantee you that the people who you predict will survive by the end of the film, survives!!! Bottomline, avoid this movie at all costs! Don't buy a cinema ticket, don't rent it, don't even watch it on tv!!! Avoid Avoid Avoid!!!!! OH YES!!! There's more! (Spoiler Alert) After the end credits there is a terrible rap song sung by the cast of the movie obviously about sharks!!! This was the icing on the terrible cake this film made! Again, avoid this movie like the plague!!!!

Okay, so I already knew this movie was gonna be awful from the premise down to the title but I wanted to watch anyway because I'm a shark buff. That ended up backfiring because you start picking apart all the ways the writers make these creatures defy their very natures to kill these boring teenagers. You know who's gonna die and who's gonna live, you even know what order. Its fine if you need some background noise while you read?
